B619E788B66E4CB89BE0B8811AE761FC.description:
use singular and plural
nouns with matching
verbs, use past, present, and
future verb tenses, use frequently occurring
prepositions and
conjunctions, and produce and expand
simple and compound
sentences
in response to prompts.

62F1DD656EA946ADA2022BFF22C7F2EA.description:
use an increasing number
of singular and plural
nouns and verbs, use present and past verb
tenses with appropriate
subject-verb agreement, use frequently occurring
prepositions and
conjunctions, and produce and expand
simple and some
compound sentences
in response to prompts.

D75702EFF04641B19CF1ECF5A8765F00.description:
with support (including
modeled sentences), use some singular and
plural nouns, use verbs in the present
and past tenses, use frequently occurring
prepositions and
conjunctions, and produce and expand
simple sentences
in response to prompts.

48FF2FB901B9482DB2ED5FBC20DD8B2D.description:
with support (including
visual aids and sentences) recognize and use
frequently occurring
nouns, verbs,
prepositions, and
conjunctions (e.g., and,
but, or) and produce simple
sentences.

21F8A50A77714964A8A737A3187E657A.description:
with support (including
context and visual aids), understand and use a
small number of
frequently occurring
nouns and verbs, understand and use
very simple sentences, and respond to simple
questions.

86D311718B0C48F1BCE3A42F233AAA1F.description:
An ELL can make accurate use
of standard
English to
communicate in
grade-appropriate
speech and
writing.

090A8C9D3B8444FAB22AF659692E94FA.description:
recount a more complex
sequence of events in
the correct order introduce a topic and provide some facts
about a topic
using temporal words to
signal event order and
using frequently occurring
conjunctions (linking
words or phrases).

AE8201A848A74F1EAA44C36CBC92AE55.description:
recount two or three
events in sequence present simple
information about a topic
with increasingly
independent control of
some temporal words (e.g.,
next, after),and some
frequently occurring linking
words (and, so).

1ECB2C1730DC4B1DBEA8909FB749B1E6.description:
with support (including
modeled sentences), retell (in speech or
writing) a simple
sequence of events in the
correct order, and present simple
information
with developing control of
some frequently occurring
linking words (e.g., and, so)
and temporal words (e.g.,
first, then).

724128F29AF14CED92D7FE38F4698402.description:
with support (including
visual aids and modeled
sentences), retell an event and present simple
information
with emerging control of
some frequently occurring
linking words.

4B9752B6999F4E9BADD6845FEF6950AC.description:
An ELL can create clear and
coherent grade-appropriate

speech and text.

E7A3844A0B7241718C7DCAF7E3306C46.description:
using context, some visual
aids, and knowledge of
morphology (e.g., simple
inflectional endings such as
-ed, -ing, and some common
prefixes), answer and ask questions to
help determine or clarify
the meaning of words,
phrases, and idiomatic
expressions
in oral presentations and
written texts about a variety
of topics, experiences, or
events.

8F9604039A14469082588872E9BA1BC8.description:
using sentence context,
visual aids, and some
knowledge of frequently
occurring root words and
their inflectional forms, answer and ask questions
to help determine the
meaning of less common
words, phrases, and
simple idiomatic
expressions
in oral presentations and
written texts about a variety
of topics, experiences, or
events.

A846489FB5544C78B0AFD6314A045710.description:
using sentence-level
context and visual aids, answer and sometimes
ask questions to help
determine the meaning
of some less frequently
occurring words and
phrases
in oral presentations,
read-alouds, and simple
texts about familiar
topics, experiences, or
events.

81DDAE9625004FAFA6D6885D067650B3.description:
with prompting and
support (including
context and visual aids), answer and sometimes
ask simple questions to
help determine the
meaning of frequently
occurring words and
phrases
in simple oral
presentations and read-alouds
about familiar
topics, experiences, or
events.

E67521913F324FC3895B894A50AAA9F4.description:
with prompting and
support (including
context and visual aids), recognize the
meaning of a few
frequently occurring
words and phrases
in simple oral
presentations and read-alouds
about familiar
topics, experiences, or
events.

786B15A0919C43B3BE2600F00BD34B85.description:
An ELL can determine the
meaning of words
and phrases in
oral presentations
and literary and
informational
text.

FE982F640D9B43F1BEEC03000003F974.description:
shift appropriately between
informal “playground
speech” and language
appropriate to the
classroom most of the time, and use words learned through
conversations, reading, and
being read to.

49A6FFEE02724149A4972B51F3585BEF.description:
show awareness of
differences between
informal “playground
speech” and language
appropriate to the
classroom, and use some words learned
through conversations,
reading, and being read to.

7BDD2977CF374CE88A4D894732E4D6A0.description:
• show a developing
awareness of the
difference between
appropriate language
for the playground and
language for the
classroom.

AEE655E91940475591076B7573652D01.description:
An ELL can adapt language
choices to
purpose, task,
and audience
when speaking
and writing.

D7320414C586401A8DD8C898CF751AE2.description:
identify appropriate
reasons an author or a
speaker gives to support
the main point.

93C8741A73174642BA95A5F78ABB0105.description:
identify reasons an author
or a speaker gives to
support the main point.

00DBFF1A52BA4FFDACBC0848BCA8C16F.description:
identify one or two
reasons an author or a
speaker gives to
support the main point.

563B8B5990644B1CB13CBEE30E68BCA2.description:
with prompting and
support, identify a reason an
author or a speaker
gives to support a
point.

F35FC997BC5641198FAAC835082A6CCB.description:
An ELL can analyze and
critique the
arguments of
others orally and
in writing.

A8279623205E47DEB78D4C7888011318.description:
with prompting and
support from adults, participate in shared
research projects, gather information, summarize information, and answer a question
from provided sources
showing independent
control.

8E1DC320292941709E6BC3153CA10842.description:
with prompting and
support from adults, participate in shared
research projects, gather information, summarize information, and answer a question
from provided sources
showing increasingly
independent control.

747D87C1933F4F5298C7DA449A73B2B4.description:
with prompting and
support from adults, participate in shared
research projects, gather information, and summarize
information
from provided sources
showing developing
control.

D2B990437BE543C59AEB869A0D55C244.description:
with prompting and
support from adults, participate in shared
research projects, gather information, and summarize some key
information
from provided sources
showing emerging
control.

EF9D932B79E644EBBC0AF53B338FAB68.description:
with prompting and
support from adults, participate in shared
research projects, gather information, and label information
from provided sources
showing limited control.

19AC0BC64EBA4C21BDE0919C4476B646.description:
An ELL can conduct research and
evaluate and
communicate findings to
answer questions or
solve problems.

A544689F6580411DB3F50B91320410DD.description:
express opinions, introduce the topic, give a reason for the
opinion, and provide a sense of
closure
about a variety of texts,
topics, experiences, or
events.

C45E4DD7021F4860B0DE2089F653C94A.description:
express opinions and give a reason for the
opinion
about a variety of texts
topics, experiences, and
events.

12E86A3B5F56493BA3D471CDB9416D3F.description:
express an opinion and give a reason for the
opinion
about familiar stories,
experiences, or events.

333005685BC6494A98D8D69D0B4A46AF.description:
express an opinion
about familiar topics,
experiences, or events.

204B1AF3D1D843ED88180E4A36072872.description:
express a preference
or opinion
about familiar topics
or experiences.

F77CD2F14B544299AE6B9E132FB80060.description:
An ELL can construct grade-appropriate
oral and
written claims and
support them with
reasoning and evidence.

BCAA1F0CBDE44096B33AA561A1784BA7.description:
including a few
descriptive details, deliver oral
presentations, and compose written texts
about a variety of texts,
topics, experiences, or
events.

BBC927DC1A9E40D2A81621728871FBBC.description:
and drawings or
illustrations, deliver short simple
oral presentations, and compose written texts
about a variety of texts,
topics, experiences, or
events.

8FB347CC8A1E42EF9231B6A6A7A84585.description:
deliver short simple
oral presentations and compose short written
texts
about familiar topics,
stories, experiences, or
events.

B1B73CB8FA6F401293BBF7EA3FBEC846.description:
communicate simple
messages
about familiar topics,
experiences, or events.

D8363283758D42C4BEEEA17B42A65187.description:
communicate simple
information or
feelings
about familiar topics or
experiences

9B92F4AE3FAF4BBFA74811EA5B0871C4.description:
An ELL can speak and write about
grade-appropriate
complex literary and
informational texts and
topics.

CB1A603F31EE47529462F7A58E265EA7.description:
participate in extended
discussions,
conversations, and
written exchanges, follow rules for
discussion, ask and answer
questions, build on the comments
of others, and contribute his or her
own comments
about a variety of topics
and texts

D03204D126E74F6CBDCE67BDCF27BD06.description:
participate in discussions,
conversations, and
written exchanges, follow rules for
discussion, ask and answer questions, respond to the
comments of others, and make comments of his or
her own
about a variety of topics
and texts.

7F775958B5E04877B2CD052CA1005575.description:
participate in short
discussions,
conversations, and short
written exchanges , follow rules for
discussion, and ask and answer simple
questions about familiar topics

E22F19FABCF5438980F1EEBD1EABD136.description:
participate in short
conversations take turns and respond to simple yes/no
and wh- questions about familiar topics

5B6A544BC53E499EAA2128F9293F010D.description:
listen to short
conversations
• respond to simple
yes/no and some whquestions

about familiar topics.

A1222F70FA064864971E06E12BA17671.description:
An ELL can participate in
grade-appropriate
oral
and written
exchanges of
information,
ideas, and
analyses,
responding to
peer, audience,
or reader
comments and
questions.

F5C3F94E494B4904B2395B9EAC83B782.description:
use a wide range of
strategies to: identify main topics, ask and answer
questions about key
details, and retell stories, including
key details
from read-alouds, written
texts, and oral
presentations.

70FA344816A24591ADAF63FE301F8194.description:
use an increasing range of
strategies to: identify main topics, ask and answer
questions about an
increasing number of key
details, and retell familiar stories or
episodes of stories
from read-alouds, written
texts, and oral
presentations.

AE5C1DCC7A6C4DE794F9BF3FCF34B788.description:
use a developing set of
strategies to: identify main topics, answer questions about
key details, and retell some key details or
events
from read-aloud texts,
simple written texts, and
oral presentations.

055B73C57CE24168AF4172D0D7B6390D.description:
use an emerging set of
strategies to: identify key words and
phrases
from read-alouds, simple
written texts, and oral
presentations.

3ACC3781495C4617AA56982A63F1C8C0.description:
with prompting and
support (including context
and visual aids), use a very
limited set of strategies to: identify a few key words
from read-alouds, picture
books, and oral
presentations.

EFD7FC9C14DE475FB9A0CEB3EBF28C6A.description:
An ELL can construct
meaning from
oral
presentations
and literary and
informational
text through
grade-appropriate

listening,
reading, and
viewing.
